Description: Floor sherd (with turn of lip just preserved) of East Greek (South Ionian) pottery bowl; orange clay with much silver mica; exterior: two sets of painted stripes, broad band at bottom of fragment; interior: two broad brown-red-brown bands; inscription cut on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 429)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.889)
